channel.title: Accessor Methods in a bot?
channel.description:
I am trying to understand accessor methods at the moment and I was wondering when they would need to be ran in a bot . Would they be ran before the client loads or can they be ran after it has loaded? Does it matter when they are ran?
Any help would be appreciated.

item.title: Accessor Methods in a bot?
item.dc:creator: @rulereric rulereric
item.description:
@rulereric wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:10, topic:240497”]u sed technically so i assumed thats what you meant

wdf do you mean[/quote]
He said object and reflect.

Assuming he has a instance of the object.

re·flect   [ri-flekt] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation 
–verb (used with object) 1.	to cast back (light, heat, sound, etc.) from a surface: The mirror reflected the light onto the wall. 
2.	to give back or show an image of; mirror. 
3.	(of an act or its result) to serve to cast or bring (credit, discredit, etc.) on its performer. 
4.	to reproduce; show: followers reflecting the views of the leader. 
5.	to throw or cast back; cause to return or rebound: Her bitterness reflects gloom on all her family.

He means cast by saying reflect.

e.g.
He can cast it to the interface type and call the method.

Read full topic

item.title: Accessor Methods in a bot?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:5, topic:240497”][quote author=Epidemic link=topic=316815.msg2515154#msg2515154 date=1225543128]
Ahhh I think I get it now, using your tutorial as an example. If i wanted BaseX I would just use…

getBaseX();

… when I wanted it. Please correct me if I am wrong.
[/quote]
Well technically, you would reflect the instance of that object and then call getXXXXX() on it.[/quote]no, reflection is stupid for this

Read full topic
